author: Special Correspondent
text:
The three-day entrepreneurship awareness camp sponsored by the Entrepreneurship Development Institute of India, Gandhinagar, Gujarat, in collaboration with National Implementing and Monitoring Agency for Training, New Delhi, concluded at the K.S.R. College of Technology on Saturday.

The camp was held under the auspices of the Department of Biotechnology of the college.

K. Thyagarajah, Principal, K.S.R. College of Technology, delivered the presidential address.

The chief guest of the function Bernard Allan Cohen, Founder - CEO and President of Neurological Monitoring Associates, Milwaukee, Wisconsin, USA, in his inaugural address presented all the possible ways to achieve success as an entrepreneur.

Through his lecture he gave a complete insight towards the importance of ethics to be followed in research to develop as an entrepreneur.

Cultivation techniques

Training was imparted on latest techniques involved in mushroom cultivation, bio-fertilizer formulation, vermin-compost preparation, medicinal plant cultivation and soil health maintenance to the biotechnology students.
title: Awareness camp concludes
